snippet: Eric L. Williams, a former Texas justice of the peace who was convicted of theft and prosecuted by the district attorney who was fatally shot last March, has been charged with making a terroristic threat.
abstract: Eric Lyle Williams, former Texas justice of peace who has been questioned in murders of prosecutors Mike McLelland and Mark E Hasse, is arrested on charges that include making threat; charges are not believed to be connected to killings; he was prosecuted by the two district attorneys on theft charges in 2012 and convicted

byline.original: By SERGE F. KOVALESKI and MANNY FERNANDEZ
byline.contributor: Susan Beachy and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Eric L. Williams, a former Texas justice of the peace who was convicted of theft and prosecuted by the district attorney who was fatally shot last March, has been charged with making a terroristic threat.

headline.seo: Texas Official Ousted by McLelland’s Office Is Charged With Threat
headline.main: Texas Official Questioned in Killings Is Held Over Alleged Threat
headline.print_headline: Texas Official Questioned in Killings Is Held Over Alleged Threat
